author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sameer, Pankaj’s passports seized; three properties searched today

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday issued summons to Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Chhagan Bhujbal’s son Pankaj in connection with the money laundering case that the agency has been investigating since last year.

Earlier this week, the ED arrested Mr. Bhujbal’s nephew, Sameer, in connection with the case, in which the Bhujbal family is alleged to have received crores of rupees as kickbacks in exchange for awarding government contracts to specific contractors. This money, it has been alleged, was then laundered after channeling it through a series of companies.

“We have issued a summons to Pankaj on Saturday, asking him to present himself before us for inquiries,” said an official.
title: ED summons Pankaj Bhujbal
